IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: PROVISION OF CARE TO THE ELDERLY
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE PRESBYTERIAN HOMES IS TO HONOR GOD BY ENRICHING THE LIVES AND TOUCHING THE HEARTS OF THOSE WE SERVE. THE PRESBYTERIAN HOMES PROVIDES SENIOR ADULTS WITH CARING AND HIGH QUALITY SERVICES IN SUPPORT OF THEIR PHYSICAL, INTELLECTUAL, SOCIAL AND SPIRITUAL WELL-BEING.
IRS990.Desc: GLENAIRE, INC PROVIDES RESIDENTIAL, ASSISTED LIVING AND NURSING CARE FOR APPROXIMATELY 421 ELDERLY RESIDENTS. SERVICES INCLUDE HOUSEKEEPING, FOOD SERVICE, MEDICAL AND OTHER SUPPORT SERVICES IN A CONTINUING CARE COMMUNITY.

InvstProgramRelatedOrgGrp.Desc: OPERATING RESERVE REQUIRED BY STATE STATUTE

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PRESBYTERIAN HOMES, INC. AND GLENAIRE, INC. ARE NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES UNDER INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 501(c)(3), AND THE PRESBYTERIAN HOMES FOUNDATION, INC. IS AN ORGANIZATION EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES UNDER INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 501(a). THE ORGANIZATION HAS DETERMINED THAT IT DOES NOT HAVE ANY MATERIAL UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS OR OBLIGATIONS AS OF SEPTEMBER 30, 2018. IT IS THE ORGANIZATION'S POLICY TO EVALUATE ALL TAX POSITIONS TO IDENTIFY ANY THAT MAY BE CONSIDERED UNCERTAIN. ALL IDENTIFIED MATERIAL TAX POSITIONS ARE ASSESSED AND MEASURED BY A MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT THRESHOLD TO DETERMINE IF THE TAX POSITION IS UNCERTAIN AND WHAT, IF ANY, THE EFFECT OF THE UNCERTAIN TAX POSITION MAY HAVE ON THE COMBINED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. NO MATERIAL UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS WERE IDENTIFIED FOR 2018 AND 2017.
TRANSFERS OF ASSETS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES: -67,396; INTEREST RATE SWAP: 330,745
FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO RESIDENTS INCLUDED IN REVENUE ON FINANCIALS: 402,078
FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO RESIDENTS INCLUDED IN REVENUE ON FINANCIALS: -402,078

THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO RESIDENTS TO HELP SUBSIDIZE RESIDENT MONTHLY FEES. GRANT APPLICATIONS ARE MADE TO THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISCUSSED WITH THE PRESBYTERIAN HOMES INC MANAGEMENT TEAM. RESIDENTS ON SCHOLARSHIP ARE ASKED TO UPDATE THEIR FINANCIAL INFORMATION ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. THE ORGANIZATION'S ACCOUNTING DEPARTMENT TRACKS THE NEED AND USE OF THIS ASSISTANCE.

THE VICE PRESIDENT OF HUMAN RESOURCES COMPILES COMPARABILITY DATA FROM AN INDEPENDENT SALARY CONSULTANT TO CALCULATE A WAGE FOR EXECUTIVE POSITIONS AND FROM AN INDEPENDENT SALARY SURVEY TO CALCULATE A WAGE FOR ALL OTHER POSITIONS AT MARKET AVERAGE. WITH THE EXCEPTION OF PROVIDING A VEHICLE FOR THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, ALL FRINGES OFFERED ARE EXACTLY THE SAME AS FOR ANY OTHER EMPLOYEE. THE OFFICER'S COMPENSATION IS CALCULATED USING THE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION PLAN APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF GOVERNORS. THE BOARD OF GOVERNORS HAS OVERSIGHT OF RELATED ORGANIZATION PRESBYTERIAN HOMES, INC. THE ASSISTANT SECRETARY'S COMPENSATION IS REVIEWED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD FOR REASONABLENESS AND APPROVAL. ALL OTHER WAGES ARE CALCULATED FOLLOWING A BUDGETED AMOUNT WHICH IS APPROVED BY THE BOARDS. THIS IS DOCUMENTED IN THE BOARD MINUTES.

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: Refunding of Prior Bonds Issued for Co
Refunding of Prior Bonds Issued for Co

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GLENAIRE INC PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO RESIDENTS THROUGH REDUCED MONTHLY SERVICE FEES AND BY PARTICIPATION IN MEDICAID. THE FUNDS RECEIVED ARE INCLUDED IN RESIDENT FEES AT THE NET AMOUNT COLLECTED.
ALL GLENAIRE INC EMPLOYEES ARE PAID UNDER RELATED ORGANIZATION PRESBYTERIAN HOMES INC.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FINANCE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD IS RESPONSIBLE FOR REVIEWING THE FORM 990. A COPY OF THE FORM 990 WAS PROVIDED TO EACH FINANCE COMMITTEE MEMBER. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD ANNUALLY REVIEWS AND RECOMMENDS THE COMPENSATION PAID AND REPORTS TO THE FULL BOARD FOR APPROVAL. THE 2017 WAGES WERE APPROVED AS FILED. THE FINANCE COMMITTEE MEMBERS HAD A QUESTION AND ANSWER PERIOD WITH MEMBERS OF MANAGEMENT. THE MEMBERS THEN VOTED ON APPROVING THE FORM 990. THE FINANCE COMMITTEE MINUTES INCLUDED DOCUMENTATION OF THE PROCESS AND DISCUSSION. AFTER FILING THE FORM 990, THE FINANCE COMMITTEE REPORTED ON THE 990 TO THE FULL BOARD. THE FORM 990 IS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST TO THE OTHER BOARD MEMBERS. THE BOARD MINUTES INCLUDED DOCUMENTATION OF THE PROCESS AND DISCUSSION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS PRESENTED TO THE BOARD MEMBERS ANNUALLY FOR REVIEW AND DATED SIGNATURE. BOARD MEMBERS AND MANAGEMENT UNDERSTAND THAT NO AGREEMENTS ARE ARRANGED TO CREATE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST. ANY NONCOMPLIANCE IS DISCUSSED AND NOTED IN THE BOARD MINUTES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE VICE PRESIDENT OF HUMAN RESOURCES COMPILES COMPARABILITY DATA FROM AN INDEPENDENT SALARY CONSULTANT TO CALCULATE A WAGE FOR EXECUTIVE POSITIONS AND FROM AN INDEPENDENT SALARY SURVEY TO CALCULATE A WAGE FOR ALL OTHER POSITIONS AT MARKET AVERAGE. WITH THE EXCEPTION OF PROVIDING A VEHICLE FOR THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, ALL FRINGES OFFERED ARE EXACTLY THE SAME AS FOR ANY OTHER EMPLOYEE. THE OFFICER'S COMPENSATION IS CALCULATED USING THE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION PLAN APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF GOVERNORS. THE BOARD OF GOVERNORS HAS OVERSIGHT OF RELATED ORGANIZATION PRESBYTERIAN HOMES, INC. THE ASSISTANT SECRETARY'S COMPENSATION IS REVIEWED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD FOR REASONABLENESS AND APPROVAL. ALL OTHER WAGES ARE CALCULATED FOLLOWING A BUDGETED AMOUNT WHICH IS APPROVED BY THE BOARDS. THIS IS DOCUMENTED IN THE BOARD MINUTES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST AT THE HOME OFFICE. THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE ALSO AVAILABLE ONLINE AT WWW.NCDOI.COM.
ALL GLENAIRE INC EMPLOYEES ARE PAID UNDER RELATED ORGANIZATION PRESBYTERIAN HOMES INC. FUNDS ARE TRANSFERRED FROM GLENAIRE INC. TO COVER COSTS.
ALL GLENAIRE INC. EMPLOYEES ARE PAID UNDER RELATED ORGANIZATION PRESBYTERIAN HOMES INC.
THIS INCLUDES MISCELLANEOUS EXPENSES SUCH AS CORPORATE ALLOCATION, MAINTENANCE AND REPAIR, AND COST OF THERAPIES.
TRANSFERS OF ASSETS BETWEEN COMMUNITIES (PRESBYTERIAN HOMES INC): -67,396; INTEREST RATE SWAP: 330,745
